title: Feature-based linear predictor generalizes for periodic HEO
statement_md: A lightweight linear model on theory-guided features (autocorrelations, run statistics, low-frequency spectrum, modular profiles) achieves small generalization error for predicting $\mathbf{H}_d^S(k)$ on synthetic periodic corpora; concretely, the mean absolute error on held-out data is $\le 0.02$.
assumptions_md: Sequences are binary periodic fixtures drawn from a family with bounded period and varied densities; target is the global HEO $\mathbf{H}=\limsup_N \frac{1}{N}\sum_{n\le N} X(n)$ which equals the period average.
evidence: Empirical risk minimization with ridge regression on synthetic periodic datasets
Theoretic sufficiency: mean density is a linear functional of the indicator; features approximate it without leaking the label
